intro: Epilobium bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian willow or Bolivian hairy willow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and riverbanks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem and showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
